newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products limp sideways, fuel oil dips.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products limp sideways, fuel oil dips.

text.p: NWE oil products were steady to weaker on Monday although holidays in London meant business was very thin.
Gasoline barges traded at $194 a tonne fob ARA, unchanged from Friday, and then bids eroded down to around $191.
Traders said they were awaiting the open of business in the U.S. before judging where the market lay.
Fuel oil dipped slightly within its recently established range. Bids were pegged at around $81 a tonne, with offers a dollar or two above that.
Heating oil barges were pegged at little differential to the screen, and offered 75 cents to a dollar above it.
The closure of the IPE for the Bank Holiday in Britain was hampering trade.
